title: What does it take to get an S with Jhin on ARAM?
body:
I just had a game in which I was 16-4-17 (out of 43 team kills for about 77% kill participation). This isn't a QQ thread. I wasn't expecting to get an S because I've seen Jhins go 20+ kills with 2 deaths and still not get it. But I really wasn't expecting a B+ as my grade. Which made me wonder what exactly you needed for an S?

So, if anyone has earned any S grade with Jhin on ARAM, can you please share your score? I'm honestly just curious how absurd his grading curve is, because apparently 16-4-17 is a B+, which on most other champs would be at least an A+, probably higher.

replies.body:
To get an S with Jhin, you need a score of 4/4/4 and a cs of 4, 44, or 444.

It also helps if your damage and healing follow that pattern.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0Ff30tAx,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-07-31T07:37:32.507+0000)
>
> To get an S with Jhin, you need a score of 4/4/4 and a cs of 4, 44, or 444.
> 
> It also helps if your damage and healing follow that pattern.

Feels good man {{champion:202}} 

(But no really it's probably the CS and overall damage)
To get an S+ in ARAM as Jhin (I think it was an S+, I got a chest soo) I went 38/12/47 with 124 CS. The game lasted about 40 minutes.

CS on ARAM is such a weird concept. I long ago just stopped taking CS on ARAM because there's no reason to fight teammates for it. I usually just buy an income item or rely on kills for gold. Like if that stops you from getting an S on ARAM that's kind of like the ultimate feel bad. I'm a support player at heart, taking CS is forbidden for me. D;
Your cs was probably non existent.
